page.title: 13Chatteris - A Child's Day
page.content: Monday morning I reluctantly roll out of bed at 7.30. I wash, dress and have breakfast. Mum cooks me bacon and eggs. At 8.00 I make my bed and clean my teeth. Half an hour later my school bag is packed and I am ready to walk to school. It takes about 10 mins. and I have to be there by 8.55. At 9.00 the whistle blows and we walk into school. Morning school begins with an assembly where we sing hymns, say prayers and listen to a talk by our Headmaster. The we have any notices concerning future events in our school. We look smart in our school uniform, which consists of a grey skirt, a white blouse, striped tie and grey cardigan. The boys wear the same colours but have long trousers and jumpers. After Assembly, work begins.
